title: Regarding slow email downloading problem
content:
Like some other users, my TB (v134.0.1) was still slow to find and download my emails. Even though TB was lightning fast for years before this slowness epidemic started, I decided to fiddle with settings. I tried various things that seemed logical, but had no success until I changed the "Connection Security" in "Server Settings" for all my accounts from SSL/TLS to STARTTLS. My guess is that the TB devs have changed the way it communicates with mail servers about security and some can't deal with it quickly enough!

Your mileage will likely vary, so make a note of your settings before changing anything and only ever change one type of setting at a time in only one account before doing a test. I hope this helps at least some users and reduces their frustration.
creator: Jay.Dear

title: Topic: Unable to send emails: Message says (Add Security Exception)
content:
Hi, I'm unable to send emails or reply to emails. I keep getting a window pop up that says 'Add Security Exception' Then after I close that the following message comes up

Sending of message failed Unable to communicate securely with peer requested domain name does not match the server's certificate The configuration related to must be corrected.

I have no idea what all this means. It's only just started happening since I did a Thunderbird upgrade. I hope you are able to help me please? My apologies but I'm unable to attach screenshot pictures. Thank you for your time. Kind Regards Jen
creator: rjwrev
